Cape Kraken0696435zz3k89kxxdn0ewoh0489jse5zhfp91209382014-03-29T15:13:02ZThe Boy Who Cried Direwolf5928719p.[[Image:Cape Kraken.png|thumb|right|200px|A map showing the location of Cape Kraken on the continent of Westeros.]]
'''Cape Kraken''' is a region in the south-west of [[the North]]. It is south-west of [[Moat Cailin]], west of the [[Neck]] and south of [[Blazewater Bay]]. [[Ironman's Bay]] and the [[Iron Islands]] are to their south. The castle [[Flint's Finger]] is in the north-east of the region.<ref>[http://viewers-guide.hbo.com/game-of-thrones/season2/#!/locations/moat-cailin/ HBO viewers guide, season 2 map, Moat Cailin entry]</ref>
sections.In the books: In the ''[[A Song of Ice and Fire]]'' novels, Cape Kraken is named for the [[Ironborn|ironborn]] (whose sigil is a [[Krakens|kraken]]) who used to raid heavily along its coasts. Being located south of the Neck, its cultural and social ties with [[Winterfell]] are somewhat loose.
